sentence.idiomatic: Our company's remuneration is very good.
The salary for a teacher is pretty good?
The remuneration at their company is not good and not bad.
I can't afford a very expensive car. I can only afford this kind.
You can't even afford to buy an overcoat?
It isn't that I can't afford it, it's that I don't want to buy one.
I want to get a mortgage to buy a house.
Which bank is your loan with?
I borrowed money from a friend; I don't have a loan.
I've already returned the book to the library.
Did he give you back the money?
He borrowed money from me, and hasn't paid me back yet.
You need at least three people to do this work.
I have to return to my home country at least once a year.
I don't have any money, but at least I have good health.
That woman loves to meddle in other people's business.
She doesn't like to meddle in others' business.
Don't be nosy about other people's business.
I heard that you work at a big company now.
I'm just a lowly staff member.
It's not the same. The salary must be very good, no?
It's average.
How much do you make?
Not much.
That couldn't be. I heard that you moved lately. How big is your new house?
Not that big. I can't afford a big house.
Nowadays houses are so expensive, only rich people like you can afford one.
It's mortgaged. I still have decades left on it.
At least you have a house. Oh, I just saw you come out of the parking lot. Did you buy a car?
No, it's a friend's car.
Oh, what about your girlfriend? Are you still with the same girl?
Uh-huh.
When are you going to get married?
After a while. My friend is here, I have to go. Next time you have some free time we'll go eat together.
OK, don't forget.
So nosy.
